translated: The Collection of Long Sayings .
The Questions of the Youth Nāḷijapa
“There are sages in the world,
(so says the venerable Nanda)🔽People say this, how is it?
Do they call a sage one who has attained knowledge,
Or one who has attained life?”

analyzed: na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena
translated: “Not by view, not by hearsay, not by logical reasoning, not by acceptance of a view after pondering it, not by inferential reasoning, not by seeming logical reasoning, not by the appearance of a reason, not by the consideration ‘it is spoken by the ascetic,’
Here, Nanda, the skillful ones call a sage;
Those who wander about without a home, free from grief, free from defilements,

analyzed: caranti ye te munayaḥ uti brūmi
translated: I say they are sages.”
“Those ascetics and brahmins,
(so says the venerable Nanda)
Who say purity is by what is seen and heard,
Who say purity is by virtue and practices,
Who say purity is by many forms,

original: Kaccissu te bhagavā tattha yatā carantā,
analyzed: kaccissu te bhagavā tattha yatā carantā
translated: Have they, Blessed One, gone beyond birth and old age,
Birth and old age, dear Sir?

original: Pucchāmi taṁ bhagavā brūhi me taṁ”.
analyzed: pucchāmi tam bhagavā brūhi me ta
translated: I ask you, Blessed One, please tell me that.”
“Those ascetics and brahmins,

analyzed: nandāti bhagavā  diṭṭhaḥ sutena api vadanti
translated: (the Blessed One said to Nanda)🔽Who say purity is by what is seen and heard,🔽Who say purity is by virtue and practices,
Who say purity is by many forms,

analyzed: kiñca api te tattha yatā caranti
translated: Though they may practice there with all their effort,
They have not crossed beyond birth and old age, I say.”
“All these ascetics and brahmins
(so said the venerable Nanda)
Declare purity by what is seen and heard;
They declare purity by virtue and practices,
By many different ways they declare purity.

original: Te ce muni brūsi anoghatiṇṇe,🔽Atha ko carahi devamanussaloke;
analyzed: te ce muni brūsi anoghatiṇṇe  atha kaḥ carahi deva manussa loke
translated: If you say they are not liberated, O Sage,🔽Then who in the world of gods and humans
Has crossed beyond birth and old age, O Lord?

original: Pucchāmi taṁ bhagavā brūhi me taṁ”.
analyzed: pucchāmi tam bhagavā brūhi me ta
translated: I ask you, Blessed One, please tell me.”
“I do not say that all ascetics and brahmins
(the Blessed One said to Nanda)
Are covered by birth and old age;

original: Ye sīdha diṭṭhaṁ va sutaṁ mutaṁ vā,🔽Sīlabbataṁ vāpi pahāya sabbaṁ.
analyzed: ye sīdha diṭṭham va sutam mutam vā  sīlabbatam vā api pahāya
translated: Those who have abandoned all that is seen, heard, or cognized,🔽And virtue and practices,
And all the many different forms,
Having fully understood craving, those without taints,

analyzed: te ve narāḥ oghatiṇṇāḥ ati brūmi
translated: I say they have crossed over the flood.”
“I rejoice in the words of the Great Sage,

original: Sukittitaṁ gotamanūpadhīkaṁ;🔽Ye sīdha diṭṭhaṁ va sutaṁ mutaṁ vā,
analyzed: su kittitam gotama anūpa dhīka  ye sīdha diṭṭham va sutam mutam vā
translated: Well-spoken by the wise Gotama;🔽Those who have abandoned all that is seen, heard, or cognized,
And virtue and practices,
Having abandoned all the many forms,
Having fully understood craving, and being without pollutants,

analyzed: aham pi te oghatiṇṇā ati brūmi iti
translated: I say that you have crossed the flood.”
The Questions of the Youth Nālaka is the seventh.
